channel.title: CNET Android Update
channel.description: News, analysis and tips on the Google Android operating system, and devices and apps that use it.

item.title: Android Oreo is here and you can get it soon - CNET
item.description: Google announces the name of its latest version of Android with the unveiling of a statue in Manhattan that took place while the moon was eclipsing the sun.
item.dc:creator: Alfred Ng

item.title: Google to Android developers: Cut the crappy apps, or else - CNET
item.description: Apps that are crash-prone or battery hogs are now demoted in Google Play search results so you'll be burdened with fewer one-star duds.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Waze launches Android Auto integration video - Roadshow
item.description: Popular navigation app can now be viewed on bigger in-car displays.
item.dc:creator: Jon Wong

item.title: Google's Motion Stills for Android tries to fix your video clips - CNET
item.description: The app can stabilize shaky video from your phone or produce a fast-forward version -- all designed for easy sharing on social media, of course.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S8 begins era of better Bluetooth - CNET
item.description: Bluetooth 5 short-range networks send data twice as fast or four times as far. Samsung's new flagship phone is the first to support it.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Google's Family Link unlocks Android for kids - CNET
item.description: Its newest app for Android gives parents a peek at their children's online activities while giving millions of kids 12 and under access to Google services.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Take the Android Taste Test to easily customize your phone - CNET
item.description: Tired of searching the Play Store for icon packs and launchers to personalize the look of your phone? Google's got your back.
item.dc:creator: Jason Cipriani

item.title: 15 tips for organizing your Gmail - CNET
item.description: Your inbox is a mess. Here's how you can fix that.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Jacobsson Purewal

item.title: 15 common Android problems and how to fix them - CNET
item.description: A guide for troubleshooting some of the most common and frustrating error messages seen on your Android device.
item.dc:creator: Alina Bradford

item.title: ​Google app becomes a destination, not just a search tool - CNET
item.description: An update shows the net giant wants you to rely on its mobile app to gather and present all kinds of information Google expects will be useful.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Getting started with Android Auto - CNET
item.description: Google's safety-minded car-mode software is no longer restricted to cars with compatible infotainment systems. Here's how to use it in any vehicle on nearly any Android phone.
item.dc:creator: Rick Broida

item.title: ​Adobe Lightroom for Android makes it easier to dump your PC - CNET
item.description: A new feature, the ability to edit raw photos, makes tablets and phones a more powerful option for Adobe's software for editing and cataloging photos.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: ​Google uses AI to help you find that obscure Android app - CNET
item.description: A neural network -- and a human touch -- help Google figure out which apps belong in which categories.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: ​How Google's Pixel phone builds a better photo - CNET
item.description: The new Android phone blends multiple shots into one to generate photos that look more like what your own eyes see.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Google to Apple: It's your move now on VR, smart speaker - CNET
item.description: Google's Daydream View headset and Home speaker are two products that Apple doesn't have an answer for.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Pixel, the first real Google phone, in pictures - CNET
item.description: Google added a new camera module, a smarter fingerprint reader and Android 7.1 to its new Pixel and Pixel XL phones.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Samsung wants you to appear in Note 7 advert after recall debacle - CNET
item.description: A casting call has gone out for owners of the troubled device to share their experiences in an advert.
item.dc:creator: Richard Trenholm

item.title: How Google hopes its Pixel camera will win over iPhone fans - CNET
item.description: With faster shooting, better image stabilization and artificial intelligence, Google aims its Pixel phones straight at the photographer crowd.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Facebook's Messenger Lite lights up old Android phones - CNET
item.description: The social network's quest to connect the developing world continues with a pared-back version of its messaging app.
item.dc:creator: Katie Collins

item.title: Samsung plays up Galaxy Note 7's iris scanner - CNET
item.description: The company's mobile chief touts iris recognition as the "safest security technology."
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney

item.title: Galaxy Note 7 tops every other phone display ever, testing firm says - CNET
item.description: Samsung's soon-to-be-released phone-tablet hybrid scores "very good" to "excellent" in virtually all measures of its display, according to DisplayMate.
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney

item.title: Samsung may release future Galaxy S phones with curved display only - CNET
item.description: The company might dump the flat-screen variant of its flagship lineup, hints a Samsung exec.
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney

item.title: Verizon rumored to carry new 'Nexus' phones - CNET
item.description: Tweet from known leaker Evan Blass places quotation marks around Nexus. What could that mean?
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney

item.title: First phone filled with Nougat likely to come from LG - CNET
item.description: The South Korean company will take the wraps off its new V20 phone on September 6. For now, it is the first in line with the new Android 7.0 Nougat operating system, beating even Google's Nexus brand.
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney

item.title: Samsung Pass to let you access your financial apps via your irises - CNET
item.description: The iris scanner on Samsung's new Galaxy Note 7 will retrieve your banking information in the blink of an eye.
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney
